page.title: 10LOCAL HISTORY-COITY SCHOOL
page.content: When I attended Coity Primary School, I began in the Reception Class in l946. Later I progressed to the Junior Department. The last class I went into was the top class. There were only four classrooms and outside toilets for everyone. The church hall was used as a canteen. Each classroom was heated by a large coal stove with a guard around it. There wasn't a hall and four small yards around the school were our playgrounds. Discipline was strict and the 'Stick' was used if anyone was very disobedient or naughty. Arithmetic and English were taught in the morning. Art, singing,geography and history in the afternoon. Sometimes nature study and scripture too. "Drill" was taken in the yard, and we lined up in regimental lines after playtime to go into the school.
